p:
To identify adenovirus type in our cases, two PCR assays targeting different regions of the adenovirus genome were used to amplify PCR products from BAL samples, two regions of the adenovirus hexon gene were sequenced using Sanger dideoxy sequencing methods, and these were then compared using BLAST for similarity to known adenovirus sequences in national databases. 13., 14., 15. Partial hexon gene sequences (1436â€¯bp) obtained from one PCR assay covering the hypervariable region were compared with HAdV-B7 reference strains available in GenBank (this study GenBank accession numbers MN199306, MN199307). Sequences were aligned using ClustalW embedded in BioEdit (V 7.0.5.3.), and a maximum likelihood phylogenetic tree was constructed using the Tamura 3-parameter model in MEGA7 ( Fig. 2). 16., 17. DNA extraction from all samples was done using the QIAsymphony DSP DNA Kit on the QIAsymphony instrument (QIAGEN Instruments AG, Hombrechtikon, Switzerland), the adenovirus quantitative PCR method used was the one described by Heim et al.,
13 and run on the LightCycler 480 Instrument (Roche, Basel, Switzerland).
